intro: Cyphostemma ukerewense, commonly known as the East African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, inflated fruits that turn red when mature. Cyphostemma ukerewense is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
